对于一些非人化的、wsp所谓美的公式，我尽量用人话表达出来

标题后面的百分号为会考的概率。（基于贝叶斯估计的概率 吹牛谁不会啊

导论

机器学习定义 （80%

  • 对于某类任务T 和性能度量 P，如果一个计算机程序在 T 上以 p 衡量的性能随着经验 E 而自我完善，那么称这个计算机程序在从经验 E 中学习。
  • <P,T,E><P, T, E><P,T,E>

分类

  • 监督学习
    • 分类、回归、降维
  • 无监督学习
    • 密度估计、聚类、降维、图像分割
  • 弱监督学习
    • 半监督学习、偏监督学习
  • 增强学习
    • Q−learnignQ-learnignQ−learnign

监督学习和无监督学习概念 （80%

  • 监督学习（supervisedlearningsupervised learningsupervisedlearning）

    • 监督学习 是对具有概念标记（分类）的训练样本进行学习，以尽可能对训练样本集外的数据进行标记（分类）预测。
    • 监督学习的任务是学习一个模型，使模型能够对任意给定的输入，对其相应的输出做出一个好的预测。即 利用训练数据集学习一个模型，再用模型对测试样本集进行预测。

  • 无监督学习（unsupervisedlearningunsupervised learningunsupervisedlearning）

    • 无监督学习 是对没有概念标记（分类）的训练样本进行学习，以发现训练样本集中的结构性知识。
    • 非监督学习为直接对数据进行建模。没有给定事先标记过的训练范

  • 两者区别

监督学习 无监督学习
目的明确的训练方式，知道得到的是什么 没有明确的目标，训练前不知道结果是什么
需要提前给训练集打标签 无需提前打标签
由于目标明确，可以衡量效果 几乎无法量化预测效果如何

KNN

KNNKNNKNN 是一个 监督学习 的 分类 算法。

基本思想

如果一个样本在特征空间中的 kkk 个最邻近的样本中的大多数属于某一个类别，则该样本也划分为这个类别。

KNNKNNKNN 算法中，所选择的邻居都是 已经正确分类的对象。该方法在定类决策上只依据最邻近的一个或者几个样本的类别来决定待分样本所属的类别。

e.g.e.g.e.g.

样本点间距离的选取（99%

常用距离度量方法：

  • 欧几里得距离、曼哈顿距离、余弦值、相关度 … …

欧几里得距离（99%

  • EuclideanDistanceEuclidean DistanceEuclideanDistance 定义

两个点或元组 P1=(x1，y1)P_1 =(x_1，y_1)P1​=(x1​，y1​) 和 P2=(x2，y2)P_2 = (x_2，y_2)P2​=(x2​，y2​) 的欧几里得距离定义为：

  • 对于样本空间中的两个点 X=(x1,x2,…,xn)X = (x_1, x_2, \dots , x_n)X=(x1​,x2​,…,xn​) 和 Y=(y1,y2,…,yn)Y = (y_1, y_2, \dots, y_n)Y=(y1​,y2​,…,yn​)，其欧几里得距离为：

E(X,Y)=∑i=1n(xi−yi)2E(X, Y) = \sqrt{\sum^n_{i=1}(x_i - y_i)^2} E(X,Y)=i=1∑n​(xi​−yi​)2​

曼哈顿距离（50%

dist(X,Y)=∑i=1n∣xi−yi∣dist(X, Y) = \sum_{i=1}^n |x_i - y_i| dist(X,Y)=i=1∑n​∣xi​−yi​∣

算法步骤

  1. 计算测试数据与各个训练数据之间的距离
  2. 按照距离的递增关系进行排序
  3. 选取距离最小的 kkk 个点
  4. 确定前 kkk个点所在类别的出现频率
  5. 返回前 kkk 个点中出现频率最高的类别作为测试数据的预测分类

代码实现、手搭（99%

考的只会是算法中的和核心部分

计算多维度的两个点之间的欧氏距离

获取与待测样本点距离最近的 kkk 个点

得到 kkk 个邻居中占比最高的类别（本质就是选举过程）

关于 k 的取值

kkk：临近数，即在预测目标点时取几个临近的点来预测。

kkk 取值的影响

  • 若 kkk 过小，一旦有噪声得成分存在们将会对预测产生比较大影响，例如取 kkk 值为1时，一旦最近的一个点是噪声，那么就会出现偏差，kkk 值的减小就意味着整体模型变得复杂，容易发生过拟合
  • 如果 kkk 的值取的过大时，就相当于用较大邻域中的训练实例进行预测，学习的近似误差会增大。这时与输入目标点较远实例也会对预测起作用，使预测发生错误。kkk 值的增大就意味着整体的模型变得简单

kkk 的取值尽量要取奇数，以保证在计算结果最后会产生一个较多的类别，如果取偶数可能会产生相等的情况，不利于预测

kkk 的取法

常用的方法是从 k=1k=1k=1 开始，使用检验集估计分类器的误差率。重复该过程，每次 kkk 增值1，允许增加一个近邻。选取产生最小误差率的 kkk。

一般 kkk 的取值不超过20，上限是 nnn （训练集样本点个数）的开方，随着数据集的增大，kkk 的值也要增大。

总结

  • KNNKNNKNN 算法是最简单有效的分类算法，简单且容易实现。当训练数据集很大时，需要大量的存储空间，而且需要计算待测样本和训练数据集中所有样本的距离，所以非常耗时
  • KNNKNNKNN 对于随机分布的数据集分类效果较差，对于类内间距小，类间间距大的数据集分类效果好，而且对于边界不规则的数据效果好于线性分类器。
  • KNNKNNKNN 对于样本不均衡的数据效果不好，需要进行改进。改进的方法时对 kkk 个近邻数据赋予权重，比如距离测试样本越近，权重越大。
  • KNNKNNKNN 很耗时，时间复杂度为 O(n)O(n)O(n) ，一般适用于样本数较少的数据集，当数据量大时，可以将数据以树的形式呈现，能提高速度，常用的有 kd−treekd-treekd−tree 和 ball−treeball-treeball−tree。

Basic Concepts

Introducing the basic concepts of reinforcement learning.

  • using grid examples
  • formalize concepts in the framework of Markov decision process

State

The status of the agent with to the environment.

  • For the grid-world example，the location（different respect in different agent） of the agent is the state.

State space：the set of all states S={si}i=19\mathcal{S}=\{s_i\}_{i=1}^9S={si​}i=19​.

Action

For each state, the agent can take different possible actions.

Action space of a state：the set of all possible actions of a state. A(si)={ai}i=15\mathcal{A}(s_i)=\{a_i\}_{i=1}^5A(si​)={ai​}i=15​.

（different state has different action space）

State transition

When taking an action, the agent may move from one state to another. Such a process is called state transition

Policy

A policy tells the agent which actions to take at every state.

Reward

Reward：A real number we get after taking an action.

  • A Positive reward represents encouragement to take such actions.
  • A negative reward represents punishment to take such actions.
  • Can positive mean punishment？Yes.

In the grid world example, the rewards are designed as follows:

  • If the agent attempts to exit the boundary, let rboundary=−1r_{boundary} = −1rboundary​=−1.
  • If the agent attempts to enter a forbidden cell, let rforbidden=−1r_{forbidden} = −1rforbidden​=−1.
  • If the agent reaches the target state, let rtarget=+1r_{target} = +1rtarget​=+1.
  • Otherwise, the agent obtains a reward of rother=0r_{other} = 0rother​=0.

A reward can be interpreted as a human-machine interface, with which we can guide the agent to behave as we expect.

Remarks:

  • The reward transition could be stochastic

Trajectories, returns and episode

Trajectory and returns

A trajectory is a state-action-reward chain

s1→r=0a2s2→r=0a3s5→r=0a3s8→r=1a2s9.s_{1} \xrightarrow[r=0]{a_{2}} s_{2} \xrightarrow[r=0]{a_{3}} s_{5} \xrightarrow[r=0]{a_{3}} s_{8} \xrightarrow[r=1]{a_{2}} s_{9} . s1​a2​r=0​s2​a3​r=0​s5​a3​r=0​s8​a2​r=1​s9​.

The return of this trajectory is defined as the sum of all the rewards collected along the trajectory:

return=0+0+0+1=1.\mathrm{return}=0+0+0+1=1. return=0+0+0+1=1.

Returns can be used to evaluate policies.

Discounted return

A trajectory may be infinite:

s1→a2s2→a3s5→a3s8→a2s9→a5s9→a5s9→a5s9…s_1\xrightarrow{a_{2}}s_{2}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}s_{5}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}s_{8}\xrightarrow{a_{2}}s_{9}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}s_{9}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}s_{9}\xrightarrow{a_{5}}s_{9}\ldots s1​a2​​s2​a3​​s5​a3​​s8​a2​​s9​a5​​s9​a5​​s9​a5​​s9​…

The return is

return=0+0+0+1+1+1+⋯=∞,\mathrm{return}=0+0+0+1+1+1+\cdots=\infty, return=0+0+0+1+1+1+⋯=∞,

The definition is invalid since the return diverges

Need to introduce a discount rate γ∈(0,1)\gamma\in(0,1)γ∈(0,1)

  1. the sum becomes finite
  2. balance the far and near future rewards:
    • if γ\gammaγ is close to 0, the value of the discounted return is dominated by the rewards obtained in the near future.
    • if γ\gammaγ is close to 1, the value of the discounted return is dominated by the rewards obtained in the far future.

discounted return:

discounted return=0+γ0+γ20+γ31+γ41+γ51+…=γ3(1+γ+γ2+…)=γ311−γ.\begin{aligned}discounted\ return&\begin{aligned}&=0+\gamma0+\gamma^20+\gamma^31+\gamma^41+\gamma^51+\ldots\end{aligned}\\&=\gamma^{3}(1+\gamma+\gamma^{2}+\ldots)=\gamma^{3}\frac{1}{1-\gamma}.\end{aligned} discounted return​​=0+γ0+γ20+γ31+γ41+γ51+…​=γ3(1+γ+γ2+…)=γ31−γ1​.​

Episode

When interacting with the environment by following a policy, the agent may stop at some terminal states. The resulting trajectory is called an episode (or a trial).

Example：episode

s1→a2s2→a3s5→a3s8→a2s9s_{1}\xrightarrow{a_{2}}s_{2}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}s_{5}\xrightarrow{a_{3}}s_{8}\xrightarrow{a_{2}}s_{9} s1​a2​​s2​a3​​s5​a3​​s8​a2​​s9​

An episode is usually assumed to be a finite trajectory. Tasks with episodes are called episodic tasks.

some tasks may have no terminal states, meaning that the process of interacting with the environment will never end. Such tasks are called continuing tasks

we can treat episodic and continuing tasks in a unified mathematical manner by converting episodic tasks to continuing ones.

  • Option 1：we can treat the terminal state as a special absorbing state, meaning that the agent never leaves a state once reached.
  • Option2：treat the terminal state as a normal state with a policy, the agent can still leave the target state and gain r=+1r = +1r=+1 when entering the target state.

Markov decision precess（MDP）

    • Reward probability: In state sss, when taking action aaa, the probability of obtaining reward rrr is p(r∣s,a)p(r|s, a)p(r∣s,a).

      It holds that ∑r∈R(s,a)p(r∣s,a)=1\sum_{r \in \mathcal{R}(s,a)} p(r \mid s, a) = 1∑r∈R(s,a)​p(r∣s,a)=1 for any(s,a)any (s, a)any(s,a).

      It holds that ∑a∈A(s)π(a∣s)=1\sum_{a \in \mathcal{A}(s)} \pi(a \mid s) = 1∑a∈A(s)​π(a∣s)=1 for any sss in S.\mathcal{S}.S.

Bellman Equation

  • core concept：state value
  • fundamental tool：the Bellman equation

Motivation

Calculating return is important to evaluate a policy

Definition of state value

The expectation（or called expected value or mean）of GtG_{t}Gt​ is defined as the state-value function or simply state value:

vπ(s)=E[Gt∣St=s]v_{\pi}(s) = \mathbb{E}[G_t \mid S_t = s] vπ​(s)=E[Gt​∣St​=s]

Remarks：

  • It is a function of sss. It is a conditional expectation with the condition that the state starts from sss.
  • It is based on the policy π\piπ. For a different policy, the state value may be different.
  • It represents the “value” of a state. If the state value is greater, the the policy is better because greater cumulative rewards can be obtained.

Q：What is the relationship between return and state value？

A：The state value is the mean of all possible returns that can be obtained starting from a state. If everything π(a∣s),p(r∣s,a),p(s′∣s,a)\pi(a \mid s), \quad p(r \mid s, a), \quad p(s' \mid s, a)π(a∣s),p(r∣s,a),p(s′∣s,a) is deterministic, then state value is the same as return.
